name: Peddinti Sri Ram Bharadwaj
tagline: ML Systems Engineer | M.Tech CS @ IIIT Bangalore | MLOps & Distributed AI
about: As an ML Systems Engineer, I thrive on bridging the gap between cutting-edge AI research and robust, scalable production systems. My passion lies in architecting the complete end-to-end lifecycle of machine learning applications, from data curation and model fine-tuning to building autonomous MLOps pipelines for deployment, monitoring, and continuous improvement on distributed infrastructure.

projects.title: BanditSim: Autonomous MLOps Pipeline for Distributed RL
projects.description: Architected and built a 5-microservice distributed system to simulate a K-Armed Bandit problem, featuring a closed-loop MLOps cycle for autonomous drift detection and re-learning.

projects.title: QnAOps: End-to-End Production Platform for a QA System
projects.description: Orchestrated a fault-tolerant, horizontally-scalable platform for a QA service, taking full ownership of the system architecture, CI/CD automation, and infrastructure provisioning.

projects.title: The LoRA Effect: Parameter-Efficient VQA Model Tuning
projects.description: Increased a VQA model's accuracy by 13% through parameter-efficient fine-tuning (PEFT) with LoRA after spearheading the data curation phase to resolve a severe 44% class imbalance.

projects.title: Click Rate Analysis: Fairness and Bias in Ad Data
projects.description: Conducted a novel fairness audit on a 1M-row ad dataset by comparing principal components of user data across demographic groups to validate demographic parity.

projects.title: Transfer Learning Evaluation: A Study on CNNs
projects.description: Led a four-person team in a rigorous empirical study evaluating the sensitivity of 5+ major CNNs to multi-stage domain adaptation, architecting a modular TensorFlow pipeline for the analysis.

projects.title: Cashflow: Secure Financial Management System in C
projects.description: Engineered a secure, multi-tiered financial application from scratch in C, leveraging POSIX threads for concurrency and re-architecting the network layer to use TCP for data integrity.
